newsitem.title: FRANCE: Cholet-Dupont places 1.5 mln Rhone shares.
newsitem.headline: Cholet-Dupont places 1.5 mln Rhone shares.

text.p: French stockbrokers Cholet-Dupont said on Tuesday it had placed 1.5 million Rhone-Poulenc shares at 139.40 francs each.

The brokerage confirmed the placing with fund managers but declined comment on market talk that seller was the CDR state holding company in charge of selling of assets of the troubled state bank Credit Lyonnais.
It said it bought the shares off-market and had placed them with French and, above all, foreign fund managers.

Cholet-Dupont changed its recommendation on Rhone-Poulenc's stock to "buy" from "accumulate" on Monday, notably on the basis that the share was undervalued compared with others in the drugs and chemicals sector in Europe.
Rhone's share closed one franc, or 0.72 percent, up at 139.4 francs after extending Monday's surge to touch a year high intra-day of 140.6. Volume was 1,641,601 shares.
